1494473388160598016.text: We have a responsibility to prevent economic catastrophe for the American people on top of the unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic.

1494473385681817601.text: Avoiding a federal government shutdown in the middle of a pandemic and agreeing to a reasonable budget must continue to be our top priority. Tonight I voted for a short-term federal budget extension through March 11th to keep the government open during these critical times.

1347058179012767747.text: Today was a difficult and dark day in our nation’s history. But let’s be clear - our democracy prevailed. Late tonight, Congress will certify the results of the 2020 presidential election just as the U.S. Constitution empowers us to do.

1346990752799354885.text: The American people can rest assured that we will finish our work, certify the results of the 2020 election, and ensure a peaceful transition of power. Our democracy is stronger than the destructive behavior of any mob and will survive today’s egregious behavior.

1346990751700418561.text: The behavior we witnessed in the U.S. Capitol is entirely un-American. This was not a peaceful protest – this was an insurrection. These individuals should be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.

1346859005784825856.text: To ensure we achieve this new era of bipartisanship let us all commit to restoring decency and civility to our politics, and becoming the example of governing the American people deserve and the world expects.

1346859004757213188.text: Above all, we must avoid the extreme and polarizing rhetoric that only further divides the American people - I will work tirelessly to make sure we do. It is time for Americans to move closer together.

1346859003775692800.text: For the sake of the country we all love, we must commit to solving the serious problems facing our nation. With respect to the Senate, we must return to regular order. I am hopeful that we will set an agenda that invites vigorous and respectful debate on the issues that matter.

1346859002806874122.text: Now, more than ever, we must enter a new era of bipartisanship in Washington. With tight margins in the House & Senate, Ds & Rs are faced with a decision to either work together to put the priorities of our nation b4 partisan politics or double down on the dysfunctional tribalism

1346833487354093568.text: The American people have clearly expressed their will. It is now for Congress, their constitutionally elected representatives, to do our job and put their will into motion. 1272638262872506373.text: It's time to put politics aside and come together to do what is best for conserving the natural resources of this great nation. It's time to pass the Great American Outdoors Act.

1272637962489118720.text: This is an opportunity for to us to pass down a legacy to our kids, grand-kids, and generations to come. I believe this will be the most impactful nationwide conservation legislation since the Land and Water Conservation Fund was first created over 50 years ago.

1272637722478342144.text: The Great American Outdoors Act will help us to be good stewards of our public lands while at the same time creating thousands of new jobs —a bipartisan win-win.

1272637425177804804.text: The impact of failing to fund maintenance in our national parks and public lands for so long is clear to see for the hundreds of millions of visitors to our public lands each year. We need to do better at taking care of these special places.

1272637295578021891.text: The Great American Outdoors Act also puts $9.5 billion towards deferred maintenance projects on federal lands. This legislation will be the most significant reduction ever in eliminating a major portion the deferred maintenance backlog on our national parks and public lands.

1272636750922420227.text: We need to secure this funding because since the Land and Water Conservation Fund was established 55 years ago, and despite the fact that every state, every territory, and almost every county has benefited from the LWCF, it has only been fully funded twice in its history.

1272636615631032321.text: The Land and Water Conservation Fund has been responsible for helping to acquire many of our nation’s most iconic and scenic lands. Just imagine what we can achieve for our country with full LWCF funding of $900 million per year, as the Great American Outdoors Act would provide.

1272636478196195333.text: Over the last week, many of my colleagues on both sides of the aisle have taken to the floor to talk about how the Great American Outdoors Act will benefit the entire country. The beauty of our nation's great outdoors brings people together and is available for everyone to enjoy.

1263588258144899074.text: The Great American Outdoors Act will be a historic achievement, an economic stimulus when we desperately need one and protect our most treasured outdoor lands for generations to come. #GreatOutdoors

1263588257054380037.text: As we all navigate the new reality of the #COVID19 pandemic, our outdoor spaces are more important than ever. They also offer critical economic opportunities at a time when many are out of work through no fault of their own.

1263588255972253698.text: In #WV, the Land and Water Conservation Fund (LWCF) is responsible for much of the access to the Gauley and New rivers. The #GreatOutdoors Act will permanently fund this important program. It will also finally address the gigantic maintenance backlog in our national parks.

1263588254852366336.text: I am excited to get to work on passing the Great American Outdoors Act when we return from recess in June. 1243325286848102400.text: I worry that this won’t be enough, and that our small towns and rural communities will need help to maintain essential services and combat this crisis. I will continue to fight for West Virginians to make sure they get what they need in the weeks and months ahead.

1243325285514305539.text: The COVID-19 pandemic has brought this issue to the front steps of thousands of students who can’t do their homework because of unreliable broadband access. That’s why I’m proud to have secured hundreds of millions of dollars to help expand internet access in rural areas.

1243325284268597248.text: Our state and local governments are on the front lines of the #COVID19 response effort. That’s why I’m proud to have secured no less than $1.25 billion for WV in the Coronavirus Relief Fund, which also includes lending for distressed states, municipalities, and businesses.

1243325282901266437.text: Our homeless youth are among the most vulnerable in our population. That’s why I’m proud to have secured more than $13 billion to help our K-12 schools and nonprofit organizations help our homeless youth through this difficult time.

1243325281412222977.text: $350 billion is provided for small and medium businesses with fewer than 500 workers who will be able to apply for government-backed, forgivable loans to cover the costs of their workers’ wages, as well as some other business expenses such as rent, up to a maximum of $10 million.

1243325279965253638.text: We’ve strengthened unemployment benefits and ensured that laid-off workers, on average, will receive their full pay for four months. The bill ensures that all workers are protected whether they work for businesses small or large, and includes self-employed & gig economy workers.

1243325278706970629.text: As a result of our negotiations, the amount of funding for hospitals and medical facilities has increased from $75 billion to $150 billion. This surge of funding is going to be critical for recovery efforts in WV & four our healthcare workers.

Today I took their message to the Senate floor b/c our medical professionals should be taken care of first https://t.co/sP6RdkMcIM

1241751786962247688.text: I urge every West Virginian to take these recommendations seriously and stay home as much as possible. READ MORE: https://t.co/CagmZIWkHJ

1241751786056286209.text: ✋🏻 Hygiene – Wash your hands often w/ soap and water for at least 20 sec, especially after going to the bathroom, before eating & after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing. If soap and water are not readily available, use alcohol-based hand sanitizer w/ at least 60% alcohol.

1241751785167114242.text: 🍎 Food and Supplies – Supply chain issues will not be a problem. West Virginians should go to the grocery store to get what they need. Be respectful and do not hoard food or supplies.

1241751784319844353.text: 😷 Medical Equipment – Equipment is in short supply across the country and here in WV. I'm working with federal officials and private industries to get hospitals, health clinics, nursing homes, rehab facilities and first responders the equipment they need to do their jobs safely.

1241751783426396160.text: 🏖 Tourism – Anything that would attract groups of visitors should be avoided for at least the next two weeks.

1241751781950062593.text: 👷‍♂️ Shiftwork – For essential services where employers are unable to telework, employers should institute shiftwork to ensure six feet of distance between employees at all times.

1241751781106950146.text: 💻 Telework – Every West Virginian who is able to telework should do so to prevent the spread of germs at the workplace.

1241751780142329857.text: ⚕ Testing – Any person experiencing COVID-19 symptoms should be able to get a test. However, due to supply chain limitations that is not possible right now. I am in constant communication with officials to secure more testing for West Virginia.

1241751779211083776.text: 🏠 Self-isolation – Anyone older than 60, children, or those with underlying health conditions should STAY HOME. While this is difficult for us as West Virginians, it means not visiting vulnerable grandparents or having large family gatherings until this threat subsides.

1241751777948635137.text: THREAD: Today I spoke w/ Dr. Anthony Fauci of @NIH, a trusted medical expert on #COVID19. Based on our conversation, I'm sharing the following specific social distancing & safety recommendations every West Virginian should be implementing to slow the spread of COVID-19.

1207349311413071873.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr Thank you to the President of @MineWorkers Cecil Roberts, all of the coal miners and their families, my colleagues in the House and Senate, and the President for coming together to #KeepThePromise. #PromiseKept

1207349143473143808.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr By working together across party lines, since 2016, we have been able to secure lifetime healthcare benefits for 36,000 and pensions for 92,000 miners and their families. #PromiseKept

1207349033628516353.text:
@SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr I have always said we must set our priorities based on our values. 

We have done that with the fight for our coal miners and we will continue to do that for all American workers. #PromiseKept

1207348966242824192.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr In January when we get back from recess, I will be working my colleagues to move this legislation through Congress because if we cannot continue to stand up for American workers ahead of the almighty dollar and Wall Street greed, what will we fight for? #PromiseKept

1207348903156293633.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr That’s why I introduced the Stop Looting American Pensions (SLAP) Act, which would ensure companies can no longer exploit loopholes by not paying their workers and retirees what they earned. #PromiseKept https://t.co/Pz3AsgcW1y

1207348783820034048.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr We must now turn our attention to ensuring workers are no longer stripped of their hard earned benefits and put in the back of the line because of this nation’s bankruptcy laws. #PromiseKept

1207348705919193088.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr Fighting for the rights of coal miners is engrained in my family history and we have always understood that miners deserve better benefits, better health care and a better quality of life. #PromiseKept

1207348486775148544.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr On Christmas Eve 1927, the company came and threw my family out in the cold because my grandfather was trying to improve the quality of life for all coal miners. #PromiseKept

1207348174349852673.text:
@SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr My grandfather came to this wonderful country from Italy in 1900 and started working in the coal mines at the age of 9. 
 
In 1927, he had a wife and 5 kids. He couldn’t pay his bills because he wasn’t paid in money but in company scrip. #PromiseKept https://t.co/Y4xXI3Wk0X

1207347503689076738.text:
@SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown @senatemajldr On Dec. 11, I put a hold on all Senate legislation until I got assurances that a permanent fix would be delivered this year.

And this week, we finally secured a permanent fix in the spending deal, ensuring retired coal miners won’t lose their healthcare or pensions #PromiseKept

1207347275955134464.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown In November, I was proud to partner with a bipartisan group of my colleagues, including @senatemajldr, to introduce the Bipartisan American Miners Act that would secure pensions for 92,000 coal miners and their families and healthcare for 13,000 coal miners. #PromiseKept

1207346752979951617.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown I turned around and immediately introduced the American Miners Pension Act with Senator Capito and Congressman McKinley and Congressman Welch to secure pensions for 92,000 coal miners. #PromiseKept

1207346652673126400.text:
@SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown In typical fashion, Congress waited until the very last minute. But on May 1, we secured a permanent healthcare fix for 22,600 retired coal miners. 
 
Although this was a huge win, we still needed to fulfill our whole obligation and secure miners pensions. #PromiseKept

1207346486679347202.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown In January 2017 I received assurances from then President-Elect Donald Trump that he was committed to finding a fix. But by March, 22,600 coal miners received letters telling them their healthcare would be terminated by the end of April. #PromiseKept

1207346355024416769.text: @SenCapito @SenBobCasey @SenSherrodBrown In December 2016, I threatened to shutdown the government until I was assured not one coal miner would lose their healthcare. Mitch McConnell would agree to nothing other than a four-month extension on healthcare. #PromiseKept

1207346143757262851.text: That’s why I wrote the Miners Protection Act and introduced it with my fellow Senator from West Virginia @SenCapito and Senators @SenBobCasey and @SenSherrodBrown #PromiseKept

1207345822360317959.text:
In 2015, we knew the United Mine Workers of American 1974 Pension Plan was severely underfunded.

If the Plan became insolvent, these coal miners would have had their pensions cut and the government PBGC would have assumed billions of dollars in liabilities. #PromiseKept

1207345663366828032.text:
Coal miners are the most patriotic people in America. 

They have done the heavy lifting. They have done everything that has been asked of them by this country. 
 
They provided the energy that made us the greatest country on earth - the superpower of the world. #PromiseKept

1207345413503758336.text: And I want to give my sincere thanks to all of my colleagues for putting partisan politics aside and for rising above the divisiveness and tribalism in order to keep the promise we made in 1946. #PromiseKept

1207345286047305731.text: On Monday, after four long years of working hard through many uncertainties, Congress came together, Democrats and Republicans, to secure healthcare and pensions for our nation’s coal miners. #PromiseKept

1191871567355162624.text: WATCH: For the last few decades, companies have manipulated Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code to destroy union contracts, reduce health benefits and skirt pension obligations to maximize profits. My bill, the SLAP Act, will stop that. https://t.co/ekyFFyNgF3

1191828249002860545.text: Congress can no longer allow corporations to continue this exploitation of the bankruptcy code to maximize profits and skirt their obligations to the company’s employees. I urge my colleagues to support the #SLAPAct & stand with America’s working families.

1191828188114169857.text: My bill, the Stop Looting American Pensions (SLAP) Act, will put the workers at the front of the line and protect the hard-earned pensions of American workers. https://t.co/V9JZvpEO38

1191827647111802885.text: At the end of Friendly Ice Cream's bankruptcy, most of Friendly’s assets were owned by a Sun Capital affiliate free & clear of any pension claims. Those unfunded pension obligations totaled $115M and are being assumed by the PBGC.

1191826975465361410.text: After filing bankruptcy in 2018, Sears no longer possessed enough assets to pay off its creditors, esp. its pension obligations. Now those pensions are in the hands of the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corp (PBGC), which is Sears’ largest unsecured creditors, which is owed $1.5B+

1191825697574141958.text: Murray Energy has contributed 97% of the money going into the UMWA pension fund annually. With Murray’s bankruptcy filing, the UMWA pension fund will become insolvent even faster, and this crisis will snowball and impact every other multi-employer pension fund in America.

1191825434796802050.text: It is now the responsibility and duty of Congress to stop this financial engineering and close of the loopholes of our bankruptcy code. My bill, the SLAP Act, does just that.

1191825202369507336.text: For the last few decades, numerous investment firms have manipulated sections of the bankruptcy code to maximize profits by cutting wages, reducing health benefits & slashing pensions. The financial engineering used for this type of manipulation has been used time and time again. https://t.co/Y6nnBc3gNs

1191825014041001985.text: Every paycheck, 10.6M Americans put a portion of their paycheck into a pension account w/ promise & trust that it will be there when they retire. 1189160091951472646.text: Murray Energy, the largest coal company in the United States, filed for bankruptcy. If Murray rejects the UMWA pension plan obligations in Chapter 11 bankruptcy, the UMWA pension fund will be insolvent by 2020. Before last night it was projected to be insolvent by 2022.

1185307246722457600.text: FCC Commissioner @JRosenworcel understands WV and fighting for rural connectivity, and I thank her for joining us here today to ensure that everyone has access to broadband.

1185302548695179267.text: That’s what we’re fighting for because we’re not going to be able to compete, we’re not going to be able to grow, and we’re not going to be able to have a strong economy if we don’t have connectivity.

1185292342271631360.text: If you lived in rural WV in the ‘30s you probably didn’t have electricity until Pres. Franklin Roosevelt started rural electrification projects to bring us into the modern age. Today in WV, many places don’t have good connectivity, broadband, even cell service.

1185286290897551360.text: Thankful for the great questions & warm hospitality for @JRosenworcel and I today during our broadband & mobile connectivity town hall at Lewis Co High School.
